item.title: Cook Pongal at Home - Pongal Recipe
item.description: Here's a recipe for Pongal, a popular South Indian dish made with rice and lentils: Ingredients: 1 cup raw rice 1/4 cup split yellow moong dal (split yellow lentils) 4 cups water 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) 1 teaspoon cumin seeds 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns 1 tablespoon grated ginger A pinch of asafoetida (hing) 10-12 cashew nuts 10-12 curry leaves Salt to taste
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: Prepare Cauliflower Peas Masala at Home
item.description: Here's a recipe for Cauliflower Peas Masala: Ingredients: 1 small cauliflower, cut into florets 1 cup green peas 2 onions, finely chopped 2 tomatoes, finely chopped 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste 1 teaspoon cumin seeds 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) 1 teaspoon coriander powder 1/2 teaspoon garam masala Salt to tast
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Sambar at Home - Sambar recipe
item.description: Andhra-style vegetable sambar, a delicious South Indian dish made with lentils and mixed vegetables, Here's the recipe: Ingredients: 1/2 cup toor dal (split pigeon peas) 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as drumsticks, carrots, beans, brinjal, pumpkin, etc.), chopped 1 onion, finely chopped 2 tomatoes, chopped 2 tablespoons tamarind pulp 2 tablespoons sambar powder 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: Brown rice vs White rice
item.description: Brown rice and white rice are two different types of rice that undergo varying levels of processing. Here are some key differences between brown rice and white rice: Processing: Brown rice is the whole grain rice that retains its bran, germ, and endosperm layers, while white rice has had its bran and germ removed, leaving only the endosperm. Nutritional Content: Brown rice is considered more nu
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: How to prepare Palak Paneer at Home - Palak Paneer Recipe
item.description: Palak paneer is a popular North Indian dish made with spinach and paneer (Indian cheese). Here's a recipe for preparing palak paneer at home for serving four people: Ingredients: 2 cups chopped spinach (palak) 200g paneer, cut into small cubes 1 medium-sized onion, chopped 2 medium-sized tomatoes, chopped 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste 1 green chili, chopped
item.dc:creator: Reddamma D

item.title: How to prepare Mango Pickle at Home - Mango Pickle Recipe
item.description: Mango pickle is a popular Indian condiment made with raw mangoes and spices. Mango pickle is a variety of pickles prepared using mango. It is very popular in South and Southeast Asia. The pickling process in India differs from other regions mainly due to an additional spice mixture added to them after anaerobic fermentation. item.title: How to make a compost without worm/kitchen composting/organic composting
item.description: Composting is a great way to reduce waste and create nutrient-rich soil for your garden. While worm composting and kitchen composting are popular methods, there are other ways to make compost without using worms or organic kitchen waste. item.title: Indian style Spanish omelette, Egg + Potato + Onion
item.description: Egg with Potato plus Onion will make a delicious and healthy breakfast, You have have it as a Breakfast or you can have it as a Snack in the day, will also be a great starter in the barbecue. This combination of dish is called Spanish omelette, but lets make it in Indian Style. Ingredients Needed? 3 Eggs, 4 medium sized Potato (chopped in small) & 4 medium sized Onion (chopped in small), 4-5
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Egg Stuffed Paratha Home made Recipe
item.description: Egg Stuffed Paratha is a delicious and healthy Paratha dish, filled with egg mixture. Both the eggs and whole wheat are healthy as it provides the right amount of proteins and carbs. The egg mixture has finely chopped onions, green chili and coriander leaves. item.title: Growing enough Onions to Feed a Family by Yourself

Onions will be having flavonoids, which have both an antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effect. item.title: Growing enough Pudina to Feed a Family by Yourself
item.description: Pudina is easy to grow and hard to kill, which makes it one of the best plants for a beginning gardener. It's especially known for its soothing effect on the stomach. Pudina is a fast growing plant, it's good to keep it in a pot or a container with some boundary, so that it doesn’t take up all your garden or yard. item.title: Pudina chutney Recipe - Andhra Style
item.description: Pudina Chutney is a flavorful condiment and aromatic chutney to serve with rice, mudde, idli, dosa. Pudina Chutney can also be served with snacks like bonda, bajji too. item.title: Dal Bhat Recipe - Nepali Style
item.description: Dal Bhat or Nepali Dal Bhat, is a dish made of lentils and rice, actually It is considered that this is the national dish of Nepal. Generally the rice is either boiled or steamed and It is served in the middle of the dish and surrounded by the dal or lentils and sometimes with some other curries or chutney or with a pickle. item.title: Pachi Chintakaya Pachadi Recipe, Andhra Style
item.description: Andhra Style Pachi chintakaya pachadi (Green raw tamarind pickle) is an age-old dish, which is generally eaten with Rice & some also eaten with Ghee for even better taste. As we Indians love the tangy & sweetish taste of pickle, this delicious Pachi chintakaya pachadi is enjoyed by all age groups and in fact, the recipe is one among the famous Indian dishes. item.title: Researchers solve riddle of plant immune system
item.description: How do plants build resilience? An international research team led by the University of Gottingen studied the molecular mechanisms of the plant immune system. They were able to show a connection between a relatively unknown gene and resistance to pathogens. The results of the study were published in the journal The Plant Cell. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.description: To become more food self-sufficient, we should plan to collect, store and use some of the seed for your own garden.
